definitions: a parasitic nematode worm that inhabits the intestines of humans and other animals. It has hooked mouthparts with which it attaches itself to the wall of the gut, puncturing the blood vessels and feeding on the blood.

notes.text: Ancylostoma, Uncinaria, Necator, and other genera, class Phasmida, including N. americanus, which infects millions of people in the tropics

shortDefinitions: parasitic nematode worm that inhabits intestines of humans

definitions: a disease caused by an infestation of hookworms, often resulting in severe anemia.
shortDefinitions: disease caused by infestation of hookworms, often resulting in severe anaemia
